description:
The time has come for our first meetup!

After a basic introduction to Laravel for newcomers (including an overview of learning resources, tips, and probably some goodies), the main objective of this meeting will be to discuss what we want to make of this group, depending on interests, objectives, availability, etc. Programmers of all skill levels are absolutely welcome - just come with your ideas, suggestions, wishes!

If you are working on an interesting Laravel app, feel free to bring your laptop and show us what you're doing!

Looking forward to meeting you all. By then don't hesitate to start sharing ideas on this page :)

Update: Goodies!

We've received a gift from Dayle Rees (@daylerees), member of the Laravel Core development team and author of the best-selling e-book "Laravel: Code Bright" (https://leanpub.com/codebright). Free copies of his book, for Laravel Brussels members only!

venue.name: ICAB Business & Technology Incubator
venue.address_1: Witte Patersstraat 4 rue de Peres Blancs

name: First Laravel Brussels Meetup

description:
In this meetup:

1) Michaël will introduce us to the wonderful world of the Eloquent ORM, which makes it such a breeze to work with databases in Laravel. It will be the right moment for beginners to learn the basics of this essential part of the framework, and for others to discover more advanced usages. 

2) We will also discuss the novelties of the upcoming Laravel 4.1!

3) Finally, people wanting to discuss Laravel projects they're currently working on - or problems they're struggling with - will be invited to show their code :)


Of course, we won't leave each other without going for a drink. Join us!

venue.name: ICAB Business & Technology Incubator
venue.address_1: Witte Patersstraat 4 rue de Peres Blancs

name: December Laravel Meetup

description:
Talks

- [Live from Berlin] Introduction to Fortrabbit and video discussion with its co-founders! Fortrabbit is a great PHP hosting platform all Laravel developers should love, and you will find out why.

- Working with Laravel and Angular - a live coding session with Edgar Hipp, co-founder of <a>www.beequick.fr.</a> 

Looking forward to seeing you there. Please share the event on your social network of choice, and bring your friends! Beginners welcome. And yes, there will be some gifts :)

2014 News!

1 - Laravel meetups will be held every last Wednesday of the month at Pianofabriek. This is a nice place with its very own bar, so expect us to finish our events there.


2 - Our monthly meetups are now sponsored by Cartalyst! For those who don't know them yet, Cartalyst is a company working with Laravel to produce top-quality, open-source packages, including the (free) Sentry authorisation and authentication system. They're very generously covering for our costs for the whole year, so feel free to thank @dansyme and @cartalyst on twitter.
how_to_find_us: Close to the Midi train station, so people outside of Brussels shouldn't hesitate to come.
name: January Laravel Meetup

description:
Build a Laravel application from scratch, by Gilbert West


For those new to Laravel, Gilbert will demonstrate building an application from scratch, using Sentry for user authentication, Intervention for image manipulation and the whole thing will be mobile-first and responsive thanks to Foundation.

Create your own Artisan commands, by Michaël


Michaël will show how to leverage Laravel's command-line interface for your custom use. Please share your ideas on what you'd like him to build below!

Big Laravel Raffle!

This time again, there will be some very nice gifts for you to win, including a 1-year Laracasts subscription! But also 5 copies of Jeffrey Way's "Laravel Testing Decoded", Cartalyst discounts, and possibly more.


Followed by drinks @ Pianofabriek bar!
name: February Laravel Meetup

description:
Javascript, Laravel's friend, by Bart Van den Brande.


Bart will demo building a browser game using Laravel and Javascript!

Laravel in 'BeautyTale', by Matias Mäki

Matias will share lessons learned while working with Laravel at BeautyTale (www.beautytale.nl). You will find out why Laravel fits particularly well with 'lean startup' development, and discover some useful tools along the way (MVPing, Laravel Administrator).

Debug session


Are you struggling with a piece of Laravel code? Let's try to debug it together!


Drinks


At Pianofabriek bar!
name: March Laravel Meetup

description:
Create your own packages with Laravel, by Hannes Van de Vreken, Darwin Analytics

When developing applications, it may be a good idea to build certain functionalities as separate pieces of code which you can easily reuse across your projects, and even share with the wider world. Here come packages, an essential feature of modern PHP development in the age of Composer. Hannes will show us lots of useful tips, best practices and things he learned along the way!

An introduction to Vagrant, by Dries Vints, author of Laravel Weekly


Most people these days are still using utilities like MAMP or separate servers for development. In this short talk Dries will introduce Vagrant, showing how you can take the first steps to transfer your development workflow to Vagrant. This talk is aimed at absolute beginners with Vagrant.

---


Followed by drinks :)
name: April Laravel Meetup

description:
- Content Management Solutions for Laravel Applications, by Brecht Savelkoul, publisher and developer at Global Pamplets (globalpamphlets.org - in the making)

Frustrated by traditional content management systems à la Wordpress? In your search for more enjoyable code, you may have already tried some of the new CMSs based on Laravel. However, finding a satisfactory compromise between content and code may remain somewhat of a challenge. Brecht will talk about the potential of API-based solutions like prismic.io as an alternative. He will show us how to pull these into a Laravel app, and will argue in favour of his own solution of choice: connecting a static site generator (Jekyll) to a Laravel backend through basic Angular.js code.

- Planning for Laracon EU


- Raffle!

- Drinks
name: May Laravel Meetup

description:
A quick tour of Cartalyst's Platform - A Laravel Application Boilerplate, by Gilbert West

Cartalyst's Platform is a flexible and extensible way of building your application. It is not just another CMS, but a Laravel boilerplate providing you with lots of useful tools to start your application. Gilbert will show us how it works.

Laravel, how toSql()?, by Michaël

Wearing his caving helmet, Michaël will explore the hidden depths of Laravel's query builder. He will take us through the steps taken by the framework to transform simple Eloquent requests into SQL. Through this journey, you will see the power and complexity hidden behind Eloquent's ease of use, and get a better understanding of Laravel's inner workings.
name: June Laravel Meetup

description:
1. An introduction to automated development environment and Laravel Homestead

Are you still configuring servers with bash scripts or do you often use the excuse ”But it works on my machine”? Then this is something for you. Jens will explain the basics of a good software development environment and will show you how you can improve your development process with Laravel Homestead.

by Jens Segers, Auki

2. Flysystem (The League of Extraordinary Packages)

In almost all of the applications we create in our day to day lifes we work with filesystems. These days it's not just our local filesystem anymore. It's AWS S3, Dropbox, FTP (for all you oldschool cowboys), SFTP or any other cloud filesystem provider. In this talk we'll go into some of the aspects that come into play when choosing and working with filesystems and how Flysystem helps you in this process.


by Frank De Jonge, freelance developer, Amsterdam

3. Laravel intro

How facades, auto-resolving container and service providers help you with dependency injection in Laravel.

by Hannes Van De Vreken
name: Laravel Brussels goes to Ghent!

description:
Introduction to TypiCMS, by Samuel De Backer

TypiCMS is a multilingual CMS built with Laravel 4.2, Bower, Gulp and Bootstrap 3. His creator, Samuel De Backer, will show us how to install it and will demonstrate its main features, before showing us the code behind it!


Queues with Beanstalkd, by Daniel Sum

Message queues allow you to throw long-running processes in the background. Beanstalkd makes this job easy, and Daniel will show us how to use this service with Laravel!

Followed by drinks, as always :)
name: September Laravel Meetup

description:
Laravel Brussels goes to Antwerp for our October meetup! We'll be hosting the meetup at Telenet Idealabs in the center of Antwerp.

Everyone can join but RSVP fast because places are limited to 50!

BDD with PHPSpec by Dries Vints

PHPSpec allows us to test our objects in a different way than tools like PHPUnit do. Rather than focussing on testing the implementation of objects we'll test the behavior. In this talk I'll do a live coding session where we'll go over the practical usage of PHPSpec to test your objects.

Speaker: Dries Vints works as a developer lead for BeatSwitch. He also manages the Laravel community portal, Laravel.IO.

Talk details: short

REST API edge cases by Hannes Van De Vreken

If you're lucky you can use so-called REST APIs in your daily work. Except, some of the largest (social) APIs make mistakes against the basic rules of REST. If you happen to be in the process of designing a REST API, you better refresh your knowledge on those REST principles. This talk will explain some quick REST API principles with lots of real-life examples, followed by some edge case designs including soft-deletes and "likes" as sub resources.

Speaker: Hannes Van De Vreken is a developer living in Ghent, Belgium. He works with madewithlove on some interesting startup projects. He likes to learn new tricks, design patterns and tools by reading about and using all kinds of open source tools. Occasionally sends a PR to improve the tools he uses. He's a very happy member of this meetup group.

Talk details: short

A Use-Case Architecture by Shawn McCool

In this talk, we discuss breaking down an application into separate layers in order to improve testability and stability. We look at real-world examples about designing an application starting at the routing layer and diving deep into the domain.

Speaker: Shawn McCool is an independent developer and consultant living in Utrecht, where he works with the developer collective Big Name. He participates in various Laravel community projects including the organization of Laracon EU.

Talk details: long
name: Laravel Brussels goes to Antwerp!
